sequence.notes: Allylic oxidation of the alkene's methyl group, forming a mixture of allylic aldehyde and primary allylic alcohol.

Oxidation of primary alcohol(s) to aldehyde(s). The top reactant (hydroxyaldehyde) is oxidized at its primary alcohol to yield the dialdehyde product. The bottom reactant (diol) would yield an isomeric dialdehyde if oxidized, meaning it is likely an initial starting material in a two-step process, or a component in a mixture leading to the same product via a different pathway/intermediate not fully shown for this specific step.

sequence.reaction_type: Asymmetric Intramolecular Stetter Reaction / Cascade Cyclization
sequence.notes: Intramolecular cyclization of a dialdehyde catalyzed by a chiral triazolium salt, forming (+)-Nepetalactone.
